segment.source: Configuring IIS for Secure Streaming
segment.target: Configuring IIS for Secure Streaming

segment.source: Configuring IIS for Secure Streaming
segment.target: Configuring IIS for Secure Streaming

segment.source: Configuring IIS for Secure Streaming
segment.target: Configuring IIS for Secure Streaming

segment.source: With the release of Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) version 4.5, you can use HTTP and HTTPS as protocols for streaming application packages to the App-V clients.
segment.target: With the release of Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) version 4.5, you can use HTTP and HTTPS as protocols for streaming application packages to the App-V clients.

segment.source: This option enables organizations to leverage the additional scalability that IIS typically offers.
segment.target: This option enables organizations to leverage the additional scalability that IIS typically offers.

segment.source: When you use IIS as a streaming server, you can help secure the communications between the client and server by using HTTPS instead of HTTP.
segment.target: When you use IIS as a streaming server, you can help secure the communications between the client and server by using HTTPS instead of HTTP.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you want to stream applications from a file server, you should enhance the security of the communications to the application packages.
segment.target: If you want to stream applications from a file server, you should enhance the security of the communications to the application packages.

segment.source: This can be achieved using IPsec.
segment.target: This can be achieved using IPsec.

segment.source: For more information see the following topics in the TechNet Library:
segment.target: For more information see the following topics in the TechNet Library:

segment.source: For Windows Server 2003, http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=133226
segment.target: For Windows Server 2003, http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=133226

segment.source: For Windows Server 2008, http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=133227
segment.target: For Windows Server 2008, http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=133227

segment.source: MIME Types
segment.target: MIME Types

segment.source: When you use IIS to stream virtual applications with HTTP or HTTPS, to support App-V, the following MIME types must be added to the IIS server:
segment.target: When you use IIS to stream virtual applications with HTTP or HTTPS, to support App-V, the following MIME types must be added to the IIS server:

segment.source: .OSD=TXT
segment.target: .OSD=TXT

segment.source: .SFT=Binary
segment.target: .SFT=Binary

segment.source: Use the following KB articles as guidance for adding MIME types:
segment.target: Use the following KB articles as guidance for adding MIME types:

segment.source: IIS 6.0: http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=151973
segment.target: IIS 6.0: http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=151973

segment.source: IIS 7.0: http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=151977
segment.target: IIS 7.0: http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=151977

segment.source: Kerberos Authentication
segment.target: Kerberos Authentication

segment.source: When you use HTTP or HTTPS and Kerberos authentication to stream ICO, OSD, or SFT files, you are enhancing the security of your environment.
segment.target: When you use HTTP or HTTPS and Kerberos authentication to stream ICO, OSD, or SFT files, you are enhancing the security of your environment.

segment.source: However, for IIS to support Kerberos authentication, you must configure a proper Service Principal Name (SPN).
segment.target: However, for IIS to support Kerberos authentication, you must configure a proper Service Principal Name (SPN).

segment.source: The tool is available for Windows Server 2003 from the Support Tools on the installation CD and is built-in to Windows Server 2008.
segment.target: The tool is available for Windows Server 2003 from the Support Tools on the installation CD and is built-in to Windows Server 2008.

segment.source: To create an SPN, run from a command prompt while logged in as a member of Domain Administrators—for example, .
segment.target: To create an SPN, run from a command prompt while logged in as a member of Domain Administrators—for example, .
